headline: Trudeau Apologizes for Wearing Brownface at 2001 Party

headline: Fed Steps Into Repo Market to Control Rates; What to Watch at Fed Meeting; Mortgage Rates Decline
summary: Good day. The Federal Reserve is likely to cut its benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point as it wraps up its policy meeting today. The central bank also will release new economic projections at 2 p.m. EDT, and Chairman Jerome Powell will address the media at 2:30 p.m. And that’s not the only Fed action going on. The central bank yesterday injected funds into money markets and plans to do more of the same today after a sudden shortage of cash caused borrowing costs to spike.

Thirty years ago, Jonathan Nelson founded Providence Equity Partners to invest in media and communications companies, makign it one of the earliest sector-focused private-equity firms. Since then, Providence has had its ups and downs as it navigated the dot.com boom and bust of the late 1990s and the great financial crisis of 2008 and 2009. This morning, as Chris Cumming writes, Providence is squarely focused on the future after wrapping up its eighth flagship private-equity fund with more than $6 billion.
